div.p: While I was traveling here for the sake of some brothers, by chance at the inn of the Angel, I met Mr. Marcus Roist, your compatriot.

When he told me that he was going to travel towards Venice, I could not, due to our old acquaintance, refrain from recommending him to my friends, so that whether present or absent, I may, as I ought, assist the people of Zürich in whatever way I can. Farewell in the Lord and greet the other friends in my name.
To the most learned and pious Lord Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of the Church of Zürich, always to be honored as lord and brother.
